intro: To render the volcano plot, start by setting dataset options below:
Choose a statistical test to compare groups
Optionally, choose an adjustment method to correct for multiple comparisons
Optionally choose a Cell Population to highlight in the Volcano Plot - if you set this, an arrow will point out the given Cell Population on the volcano plot
When you have set your filters, click this button to generate the volcano plot...

Volcano plots are a form of scatterplot used to indicate statistical significance (p-value<0.05 are above the dashed line) in comparison to the fold change (upregulated genes are to the right of the y axis)

element: #Karyotype-VolcanoPlot.plotly.html-widget.html-widget-output.shiny-report-size.shiny-bound-output.js-plotly-plot div.plot-container.plotly div.svg-container svg.main-svg g.cartesianlayer g.subplot.xy g.plot g.scatterlayer.mlayer
intro: Click on any dot to choose a Cell Population and highlight it on the volcano plot - this will also create a boxplot showing the difference between Negative and Positive COVID-19 Status for the chosen Cell Population

Or, choose a Cell Population from this dropdown list to highlight it on the volcano plot - this will also create a boxplot showing the difference between Negative and Positive COVID-19 Status for the chosen Cell Population
Use these widgets to zoom, reset views, and download an SVG of the current plot.
This boxplot shows the difference between Negative and Positive COVID-19 Status for the chosen Cell Population
Use this widget to interact with this plot
Use the Box Select tool to select distinct sets or groups of observations - you must select at least 10 points to create a group.
Alternatively, use the Lasso Select tool to select sets or groups with finer precision
Use this widget to download a SVG of this plot
Now that you have highlighted 2 distinct groups, click here to see options to compare sets
Click this button at any point to clear the group selections from this plot
